data.title: GNU / Open Source Audio editing software???
data.meta_description:
Hurro fellow spiceheads, 
I am looking around for a GNU/Opensource editing program for Audio? 
Does anyone have suggestions? 
I am looking at Audacity right … I was wondering if any other suggestions would be available. 
…
data.text:
Hurro fellow spiceheads,

I am looking around for a GNU/Opensource editing program for Audio?

Does anyone have suggestions?

I am looking at Audacity right … I was wondering if any other suggestions would be available.

Thanks

media coder. (Audio / Video transcoder)

In the past, I have been able to create ringtones and edit audio clips with without much of a learning curve. (took me 5 minutes)

I think they have an audio only version of the software.

You have no choice here. Audacity. It sucks to be honest, but there is no other opensource audio editor I know of.

But perhaps if you specify what you need this software for, we might suggest something better suited.

Thanks Folks,

I am using it to trim and edit some audio from my Church’s services.

we record them on to DVD, I rip them to MP3 and then edit them to reburn onto a single music/playable CD for our congregation.

Im going to look at the suggestions here.

Thanks again.
